definition: troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
not troublesome

sentences.english: I wonder why Tatai bothered to set such a feast for me?
sentences.chinese: 奇怪，塔塔伊为什么要费事给我摆宴席？

sentences.english: That's not bad for a signing, but it's a lot of work.
sentences.chinese: 对于签名售书来说，这已经不错了，但很费事。

sentences.english: No one has bothered to ban a book in decades.
sentences.chinese: 也没人会费事把一本书禁个几十年。

sentences.english: Nine bead application of my vexatious rights to provoke nan peja trouble.
sentences.chinese: 九珠应用本人的无理取闹权益惹楠佩费事。

sentences.english: Courtesy costs little and means much.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌不费事，意义却很大。

sentences.english: Writing a dictionary is a long and difficult business but we're getting there.
sentences.chinese: 编写词典是费时费事的工作，但我们一定能成功。

sentences.english: It is really a pain, you know?
sentences.chinese: 做年夜饭是非常费事的，你知道吗？

sentences.english: It is difficult to chip old paint off the inside of a container.
sentences.chinese: 从容器的内壁铲下旧油漆很费事。

sentences.english: OK, the bed may be too unwieldy or expensive to replace.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，换张床可能太费事或太贵了。

sentences.english: We concluded that we were getting off lightly.
sentences.chinese: 我们的结论是，我们不会那么费事。

sentences.english: This demo needs a little work next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年这个演示也会比较费事。

sentences.english: It’s no skin off your nose, and it might save you from getting into a violent confrontation
sentences.chinese: 这一点都不费事，并能使你免除一场暴力对抗。

sentences.english: Don't bother to get dinner for me. I'll be dining out.
sentences.chinese: 不必费事为我做饭了，我到外面吃去。

sentences.english: This localization step is expensive but also important.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方化步骤虽然费事却也很重要。

definition: to expend a great deal of effort
to handle administrative work
to simplify matters/to save trouble
to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to require effort/strenuous
erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to save labor/to save effort
(usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to save labor/to save effort
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
inconvenient/troublesome/annoying/to trouble or bother sb/to put sb to trouble
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
inconvenience/inconvenient
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
